snippet.textDisplay: See, I entirely disagree on the Splitting the player base into 2 modes is a bad thing. I know a bunch of people who will never get arc because they dont want a pvp game. Those people aren't a part of the player base to begin with. The pve mode might take some of the players from the pvp mode, sure, but the pvp players then can have the mode they want to play pvp where they expect it all the time. Pve mode gets players who dont really want pvp, but also bring in the players who would never get the game in the first place, expanding the player base.

snippet.textDisplay: Why should I be comfortable with pvp? I've been watching this game stream since launch. It's very cool. I watch cohh. I HATE pvp. Last time I played pve was 25 years ago when I was obsessed with unreal and played with keyboard and mouse. I have a new gaming pc running bazzite but I'm coming from Xbox and only play with controller now. I played during the server slam, mostly just to see if it would even run on Bazzite. I died every time instantly in my runs. I'm glad they have solo servers but that's still PVP and having a mode for people that don't want to play PvP broadens the audience. I'd love to play this game but I wont as long as it's pvpve. I'm probably not the only person who feels this way. I've seen suggestions that maybe they create a pve in this universe. Might work but it's building an entire new game. This game was originally pve and they pivoted to what it is now. I can't imagine this game not being fun as a pve only. I'm also a very casual player. I don't care about gaming challenges. I just want to enjoy the world and learn the lore. This won't change. I'm an older gamer (65) and I'm never going to get Gud soooooooooo.

Boys, from the "mostly vocal minority" (40%+ of player base btw), you are so full of shit.
The game was born PvE and PvP came only recently. And don't get me wrong, I don't mind the PvP component.
What I mind is the psychos ambushing you at every corner using only starter kits.
PvP is utterly unbalanced in Arc Raiders. 
And what's with the "just get a free kit and get back on your feet" bs?
It takes multiple safe extractions to get back on a full blue kit (not even talking about pink ones or epics).
Honestly?
Just say you enjoy pointlessly killing fellow Raiders and capitalize on their hard earned loot.

snippet.textDisplay: So far, my experience has been pretty good in single queue. As for "PvE players will get bored and never migrate to PvP" makes no sense. Personally, to learn how systems work, the game SHOULD be PvE in the beginning, and then let curiosity or quests propel the player into PvPvE. Even with the game rn, you can't leave the first map without running missions, and to coop players, this can be a refund issue. I prefer PvE, but I do play PvP. I blew off extraction shooters bcz I don't like shooting other players in the back and stealing their hard won gear, nor the reverse. I'm not "that guy". but if I need to be, I will.

snippet.textDisplay:
Honestly, I don't think they should take pvp out, but they should make it exclusive to night zones like how "The Division" used to with dark zones.
Day time for PVE would make it soooo much better.  That way we could go in to do quests and not have to worry about getting camped while trying to do objectives. While trying to do missions, I often just get hunted by pvp players and then get cussed out in game chat. Honestly, if I get killed by somebody and they start cussing me out I just report them. I hope they all get band. That's why I left COD back in the day. Got tired of getting cust out all the time for no reason. This game is so much more then just another pvp game. It's a PVPVE game. We don't always have to kill each other. We can gang up on the big Arc enemies. IDK man...it just feels like the toxic pvp culture from other games is bleeding into this one, and it's just ruining the experience. Telling people to just accept it is, I think, short sighted and disregarding the main issue.

snippet.textDisplay: You guys are only looking at it from your perspective that you enjoy pvp.  I come from a point where I dont enjoy the pvp and its just trash.  95% of pvp in this game is people getting shot in the back and no retaliation.  I dont find that fun.  You think pvp will give this game legal and I believe not giving solo pvp only will send it back to the niche genre.  People are saying separating the playerbase will end the game but your wrong.  Pvpers are gonna get bored of shooting people that arent shooting back eventually and pvers are jus gonna quit because getting shot in the back with no way to respond isnt fun either.  So separating them to their playstyle will give the game a way longer playtime.  I dont know I'm not bad a the pvp it just isnt fun.  If I wanted a pvp shooter experience I'd play one of the other big shooters.  I guess making a pve solo experience with a ton more arc sounds like way more fun to me.

dude, what?
putting PvE players in their PvE mode fragments the game?

snippet.textDisplay:
I don't think that Dune is a good example and fair comparison at all. Dune was a PVE game with a few small PVP areas (where you almost never meet other players). Suddenly it turns into a full on PVP game with huge guilds killing everyone on sight. 
The difference between the first 40-80 hours and the end game is huge, it's basically two different games. It forces players to play in a way that they might not want and haven't done before in the game.
So I totally get why Funcom changed the end game the way they did.

snippet.textDisplay:
you both seem like nice and reasonable guys but your analysis on PVP-PVE is totally wrong from beginning to the end:
first the game was originally conceived as a PVE, not a PVP (So here I agree, it should respect it's DNA!). Then about fragmenting the player base, wrong again because PVE & PVP caters to 2 different kind of gamers and actually to 2 different kind of people: there is the kind that like to cooperate with fellow humans and the kind that prefers to fight them. Totally different mentality. And when you say that eventually PVE players will get use to PVP it's just mesmerizing. No, big no. It's like telling a team of footballers that they are going on a game against a basketball team on a tennis court and get use to it because that's final. And casuals have nothing to do with it, I am a hardcore gamer but I just don't enjoy PVP, I prefer exploring, crafting and fighting as a team against giant enemies. And when you force PVP on me, it's not working, I don't like it, i have never liked it &  I will never like it. And when the toxic PVP crowd will show up (they already did tbh...) then I will just quit . So no , you don't fragment, you loose part of the player base. While if you have a PVE mode only you have players like me who would love to co-opereate with other randoms to kill a queen. I will probably never kill a queen because of PVP and all the tryhards & grieffers that come along. 
Then you say there is no excitment/emotions without the human element? Well let me tell you about a game called Helldivers 2: or do I need to? You see my point? I have & will never play warzone/tarkov/fortnite but I have spent days & nights on Helldiver and I still go back from time to time.
I am only level 10 and I know I would love the game without PVP but I will probably give up soon, after a few  too many bad encounters. Also right now the gameplay it induce is really lame for us (PVE players) for example, I go to do my missions but if I don't get killed right away (I have personally not even shot once at another player!), I will eventually get a rare loot and therefore run immediately to the closest exit...
Also what is the pleasure for PVP players to kill people that are not even fighting them? That are just not in the same mindset? What's the pleasure of killing a level 2 with no loot?
And why do you call that a match? For people like me it's not a match, it's a session in an adventure. There is a real misconception here. We all are supposed to fight arc but because of PVP we fight each other and no shit gets done!!!!

snippet.textDisplay: NA Servers say they are fine with the Solo experience because they seem to have mostly friendly players helping each other against the ARCs (what makes sense and is actually the clever way). But f.eks. EU Servers are full of Exit-Rats and Loot Campers (you kill a big one, they will shoot you in the back) - somehow most of them seem to have an eastern accent (without trying to be judgy here, but 20 years of online experience told me otherwise and I don't get why it's sooo hard to make servers only for Russia). I don't think people will miss anything if the PvP Part becomes less likely. Even Shroud said there are simply too many ppl on one map and it's true and I said it from the start as well. At almost every extraction there are at least 5 people at once fighting over it (or someone camping it) and in Duos or Trios you cannot even try to kill a Bastion without 4 teams showing up - it's just too much PvP - at least on EU Servers (and yes I already deactivated Crossplay for less Kiddos). You cannot even do Trials or if you manage to do 3 stars somehow, you get killed at the Extract (and during events/double XP there are not Raider Hatches, without double XP Trials become almost undoable due to too many players spawning). It's overall a very, very frustating experience. They should either add a trial mode with only you spawning in and no possibility to take loot with you, or really lower down the spawn rate (why do ppl even spawn in until min 17? All you can really do then is looking for a fight if you still want loot and it doesn't make the game better imo).

snippet.textDisplay:
As an old head and long-time gamer, I really love this game. People compare it to a lot of looter shooters and extractors, but one thing nobody ever mentions is The Division 1. That game was peak for this genre. I put years into it. Once they went casual and stopped supporting the hardcore players, they lost me â€” Division 2 was straight trash to me.

ARC Raiders is honestly my favorite looter shooter since Division 1, but they really need to separate PvE and PvP, or at least turn off PvE when youâ€™re fighting another squad. Nothing feels worse than losing a fight because mobs piled on you. Division solved this with the Dark Zone and the rogue timer â€” it gave structure and fairness.

They also need squads of 4. Three is such a weird number when most people play with two friends or their kids. Solos/duos/quads would be perfect.

Not hating at all â€” I love the game and your content has helped me a ton. Just giving a perspective from an older gamer with limited time. Casual players will bounce if they keep getting blasted by no-lifers with OP loot.

Thanks for the review, Iâ€™ll keep watching.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think it would be cool if they implemented some game mechanic, say some shield or force field, where if you wanted to just PvE, then you equipped it before the match and can't unequip it (or like tie it to the free loadout), and it made it so the first damage you took from another Player was like SUPER nerfed. In turn, if you had it equipped and you decided to, say, jump someone, those first shots were super nerfed as well, or like super inaccurate, say, from passing through the field.

Additionally, please make it so people could see a shield/field around you, so they would know you were NOT trying to be aggressive and could decide whether they still wanted to try to take you out. Maybe they have a great position or think they're better, but IMO, if done this way, it doesn't completely remove the threat of PvP; it just gives those passifists a tiny bit of an advantage in encounters.

Not a developer, so all of this may be way too much to incorporate, but something like this could bridge the gap between both camps!

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm normally not averse to PvP in most game, but I like the PvE way more in this game than the experience of fighting players.
In this game tho, the most miserable human interactions imaginable come from people who exploit people trust and try to kill them at extract, etc.

I know people have no obligations to be friendly but damn does it hurt my heart every time someone exploit my trust. 
I'll probably stop playing if it get worse, keep playing if I still see hope in some people. 
It's not the game's fault I just don't want to feel that way just from playing a game.

snippet.textDisplay:
The Division & Division 2 would argue that you can have a strong PvP and PvE in one game.

I mainly prefer PvE, but certainly in the first Division I would play the darkzone loads!

There's a bunch of things I like about Arc Raiders (visuals / mechanics / enemies etc), but I find there are more things that infuriate me. I don't like getting a great build together only to lose it all when I'm in there. I'd much rather be able to keep my build if I die, but still lose the new content I've collected that round, that way it doesn't feel like such a slap in the face and it gives the game a sense of levelling up, whereas currently it feels kind of pointless to me.

I also feel massively overwhelmed by the shear number of items I can collect and what they are used for, what's worth keeping, what's not etc, it just doesn't feel well explained when you start.

And just a small thing, the inventory menu needs a LOT of upgrading imo. When you open it you have to move off an item and back onto it to see  it's description, which in a game where you have to be quick or you'll get downed, is a very slow process. Also when I've been looking at an item and I choose to break it down, why when I come out of that item does it move my cursor to the other side of the inventory, so I then have to scroll back to the left to get to the next piece each time?! It's soooo frustrating!

I'm really hoping over time they'll add things to address these issues, but atm I'm finding it more frustrating than enjoyable.

snippet.textDisplay: Played quite a few solo matches now where practically the entire server banded together to hunt down and destroy every boss on the map. THAT is the reason for this misalignment of values, not that a game with both PVE and PVP modes that are isolated has any issues. Its mythology that it fragments your player base. Such a complete non-sense narrative to fear monger that having flagged PVP or pure PVE mode will kill the game. If people get bored of PVE they have the option to join PVP. The idea that its going to kill the game is a lie based on the desire to smoke n00bs and gain the upper hand through lying about being friendly.

snippet.textDisplay:
So there's two things that I think that they could do right now to alleviate the PVP versus PVE. But the one thing I don't want them to see them do is change the fundamentals of the game. People are scary. Running into people is scared. I should always be a thing. We should always be the freedom to betray and kill on site 

So the first thing make Matchmaker pair stronger based off of kill death ratios. If you're dying a lot and you're not killing, a lot of people pair you with other people who are experiencing the same thing. It's not quite PVE, but it does mean that you're more likely to have the talking conversations that you looked forward to. They'll be less people who are bloodthirsty and kill on site in those lobbies and vice versa. If you have a lot of kills then pay you with people who have a lot of kills. That's obviously the play style you want to enjoy and it just makes sense now. Does this guarantee that you're going to be in a lobby without somebody who's going to backstab you or kill you? That's what I like about this. It doesn't guarantee anything. It just says we push playstyles together but we don't guarantee it just like duos doesn't guarantee you're going to be in a Duo 

The second thing is have an event doesn't have to be. You know too crazy. Use the harvester as a baseline. Have an event like to harvester but PVE only. Maybe throw in that Baron when you get the Baron out. Some of that multiple teams and multiple people are going to have to take down and maybe double the amount of Arc on the map. You know like the parents there they're out in force. Make the art super dangerous. You die. You still lose all your stuff. It doesn't change the fundamentals of the game. No. Cody on that level is going to be happening. You die. You lose your stuff. Other raiders can loot your your dead body. It's just other raiders can't kill you during that event. An event only pops up once every 3 to 5 hours. So it is a nice just breath when it pops up. But it's not going to give you up PVE only mode and but it will give you a breath
